department: Public Services and Procurement Canada ( PSPC )
short_summary: Replacement of Walker Bridge. Consult the solicitation for additional details
description: The accepted bid of Parks Canada for Walker Bridge. The details can be found on the catalog of federal graphene program
full_summary:
---

**Stage 1 - Walker Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park**
**Reference Number:** cb-413-37950661
**Amendment Number:** 8
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0257/A

**Issuance Date:** 15 December 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** 04 January 2024 (16:00:00 hours)

**Project Description:**
Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit bids for the Stage 1 - Walker Bridge Replacement, Grasslands National Park project. The project involves the replacement of the existing timber bridge with a new concrete and steel short-span bridge, as well as the construction of a new gravel grid road and the demolition of the existing bridge and road access. The project site is located near a working ranch and is situated in an area of critical habitat for multiple species at risk.

**Bid Instructions:**
Bidders must submit their bids in two stages. The first stage will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second stage will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. Bidders must submit their Stage 1 bids electronically via email or fax, with attachments in PDF format. Bidders who submit multiple emails for their Stage 1 bid must ensure that all emails include a clear indication of the solicitation number, project name, and total number of emails.

**Special Requirements:**
The project requires the Contractor to minimize environmental and archaeological impacts. Mitigations will be included in the contract to ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with the National Park Act and related regulations.

**Submission Requirements:**
The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Any discrepancies between the English and French documents must be notified to the Contracting Officer immediately.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The selection of the successful bidder will be based on the lowest price. Bidder qualifications will be evaluated in Stage 1, and a shortlist of qualified bidders will be invited to submit financial bids in Stage 2.

**Period of Contract/Delivery Date:**
The Contractor must complete the Work no later than November 30, 2024.

**Contact Information:**
Ken Lacanilao, Contracting Officer
